intro: Streptocarpus cyaneus, commonly known as the blue streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface and produces showy, spurred flowers that bloom in spring. Streptocarpus cyaneus is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
